reviewDescription: I recently picked up this Surge Protector Outlet Extender with a 5-Outlet Splitter, and it has become an essential component of my home office setup. Gone are the days of choosing which gadgets to charge and when; this power hub handles all my devices simultaneously with absolute ease.First off, the surge protector function gives me peace of mind, knowing my electronics are safeguarded against unexpected power spikes. I appreciate the design, which doesn't block other outlets and even leaves enough room for bulky adapters. It's compact enough not to be an eyesore yet robust enough to handle up to five devices - a perfect balance.The build quality is commendable, with a sturdy casing that feels durable. The outlets are well-spaced, reducing the frustration of larger plugs jostling for room. I also found the plug angle to be particularly thoughtful, allowing for better cable management and a cleaner workspace.One minor caveat, though, is that while it's excellent for most home applications, if you're planning to use all five outlets with devices that have high power demands, you might notice it getting a tad warm. It's nothing to be overly concerned about, but it's worth noting for those looking to power multiple high-draw electronics.Overall, this Surge Protector Outlet Extender with 5-Outlet Splitter is a reliable, well-built choice for anyone looking to expand their power options. It performs admirably, offering both convenience and protection for your devices. A solid four-star addition to any home or office.

It's more convenient and useful than I even thought it would be to have those USB ports just always there and always working, unlike your computer USB ports, which power off with sleep/shutdown.My ONLY complaint with it is that the weight and build of it isn't incredibly confidence-inspiring. Unplugging things from it usually unplugs the device itself if you have to pull it at all, and the overall light weight and feel makes me presume that the electronics inside aren't the most robust. We've had our share of power outages due to snow storms, and none of our devices that were plugged into these power blocks has gotten fried. I like them so much I've bought them for family. I like to wait until I've owned something for awhile before I write reviews, so I can also report on the longevity as well as the quality of the product. This one is a clear winner in my book.

If you're like me, you have a myriad of cords at your bedside, and this has been great for that purpose without having a power strip laying on the ground. It's also nice to be able to plug your phone cable directly into this to use charging blocks elsewhere. There is a screw where you have the option to remove the existing faceplate and use this instead, but you are also able to plug over existing plate, which is what I did.

I ordered these based on a recommendation by Clark Howard, syndicated consumer action reporter from Atlanta, GA. They have 4 receptacles and USB ports and a USB-C port, which I thought handy.  My phones, Kindles, and iPads charge much quicker with these devices than with the ones I was using. Even though we have a whole-house surge protector, one can’t be too careful living in the US lightening, Florida.

I guess this works fine . I say that because there is no trip or at least none to that I notice. So frankly I really don’t know if it’s actually functional or just an extra plug adapter with a light .

I purchased several of these because they were rate 1800 Joules and also bragged they used a Gas Discharge Tube which reacts very quickly to surges, which is something I wanted but rarely see in surge protectors.  Gas Discharge Tubes are expensive and they work better than MOVs.  I was surprised that they could sell so cheap and have such a high joule rating so I was skeptical.  I decided to dissect one of the units once they arrived.  Turns out these are not at all what they claim.The two blue discs you see in the photo are the MOVs (Multi Oxide Varistors).  These are used in all surge protectors and are rated in joules which is how much energy they can dissipate before destroying themselves.  The silver tube between them is what I thought would be the gas discharge tube.  Turns out it is not.I spread the MOVs apart and with a magnifying glass found the part number 14D331K which is an MOV with a rating of only 85 Joules as shown in another photo.  The numbers on the silver tube indicate it is made by AUPO and is part number BF113 and is actually a thermal fuse and NOT a gas discharge tube.  There is a huge difference in how those two components operate.In summary, this product is not even close to what they say in the description.  It is 170 joules and not 1800 joules and does not have the fast acting gas discharge tube they claim.  I will be returning them.Addtam products are also sold under other brand names on Amazon.  Beware

reviewTitle: DO NOT buy this product!  It gets over heat and strip the surge protector.
reviewDescription: I bought this product on Jun 23 and the window for return was on July 23.  I didn't see issue until the kids plug too many devices to charge.My first initial impression of the front of this product was "Wow! someone was smart enough to space out the outlets."  It has enough space to plug in chunky chargers where you can't fit two chunky chargers to the regular home outlets.  Plus, it looks nice ans sturdy.Immediately follow my good impression of the front of the product was "Seriously, this is bad design."  The back side has only one plug, which in my opinion should has two because it covers the entire wall outlets that two outlets.Sure enough, the product strips every time four of the outlets (the extended) were plugged in.  This product extends into five outlets, three USB-A, and one USB-C.  However the back side has only one plug.  If it was divided into two plugs on the back, then it would reduce the current load in the front to prevent it from stripping the surge protector all the time.Now I can't even return this product anymore.  It covers two outlets on my wall and it can only extend it into three outlets in front, so the ratio is 2:3.  You would get one more extra outlet with this product.  It's a joke.My advice to the designer/engineer.  Use the product you have created, so you can improve it.  If your product is not worthwhile for you to use it, then it tells a lot about your product.

I purchased two, one in May 2023 the other in October 2023.  At first seemed like a great product, but less than one year later, the USB charging ports stopped working.  I would not buy again.  This defect should be more prominently displayed in the product reviews.

I haven't had any power surges or other issues - the ports just don't work. So weird. I'd send it back, but window is closed. I tried to find a way to contact seller, but couldn't and these days Amazon is so difficult to get through to.

This sort of thing makes me scared to buy chargers without opening them up first.1st is it my opinion that everyone should know that your house is only wired to carry 15 amps at (about) 110 volts.  So plugging 5 devices into a single outlet is... not wise.2nd on this particular device it appears to me, that the 5 mains power is connected to the step down with these tiny little wires with insulation that is way to small.  I'm pretty sure that wire is intended only for low voltage uses (like Arduinos and LEDs, etc).  Worse they are rubbing up against the back of the solder joints on the USB charging block.Sure, while everything is working fine, the risks are low.  But things break, everything breaks eventually.  Maybe a component fails, or the sharp solder joint being pressed into that tire wire might rub through, or nearly anything else.  In my opinion when this fails it is likely to expose mains voltage to the USB ports and result in melting a device, or likely a fire.

I was looking for it to be fast charger and keep outlets available.  Charging of the phone is extremely slow. Charged my phone on regular plug from Samsung it takes 45 minutes to recharge,  moved it to this unit using the C port and it takes 1 hour 54 minutes. Not satisfied with the performance.

The only thing is that this is not gfci outlet compatible! My kitchen island has a stove in it so my outlets are gfci- was hoping to be able to use this for parties with all the crock pots but I can’t.

Handy but the tab that goes into the second  ground slow does not line up …. You can get it in one but not two like it should
Really like the multiple USB ports on this.

Actually had to put something over the light as it was almost as bright as a night light.  Helpful to have USB ports which is the primary reason I bought this model. We seem to need those even more than the extra electrical outlets now.
Wish it had the little middle screw feature to secure it to the wall outlet. Otherwise it works great just easy to dislodge.

Love that you can plug lots of stuff in one outlet and even use different kinds of plugs. However, it's not as sturdy as I'd hoped. I have to push against it when unplugging something. It's also a little tough to push the plugs into it. Overall, it's definitely worth it and works fine, just has a few minor difficulties.
It charges fast! Although I probably wouldn't use more than 1 plug for power at a time. I use 2 or 3 usb at the same time and no problem.

I have very few outlets in my bedroom. I was relying on power strips and extension cords to get everything fitting.Enter, this thing. The extra outlets are great, but it's really them being on each side and angled that carries the product. I'm able to comfortably fit everything and save space while doing it.The only downside I've encountered with it is that the USB ports don't deliver enough power for my Chromecast with Google TV. That has to unfortunately remain taking up an outlet space.
Good product

I bought this because I like the idea of multiple connections. I like the amounts of slots in it but it is not very sturdy on the outlet. Every time I try to disconnect something, the entire things comes off the wall. You have to keep plugging it back into the outlet. It becomes a hassle real fast.
Loved all the spots it has
Bought 2 of these in 2021.  Just pulled this one out of the wall because plugged in electronics weren’t working consistently anymore.  I guess this one really worked after that last storm.

This is a game changer when you have the need for multiple outlets. I will say that it gets heavy with everything plugged in. It doesn’t fall out of the outlet it’s plugged into. But it seems a little loose. I use this 24/7. And it solved my problem.

reviewTitle: Does Not Fasten to Outlet - Possibly Good for Travel
reviewDescription: Pros:5 120V receptacles3 USB A receptacles1 USB C receptacleEasy to install no screw used to secure it to the original receptacle. Great for travel if you have room for it as it is bulky.Con:Does not screw into original receptacle. This means having to hold it in place when unplugging cords.When I travel, I bring a multi-port charger that requires a single power plug and provides 5 USB A ports. When the cord is disconnected, the charger is about the size of a deck of playing cards making easy to throw in my backpack.This wall charger is a lot larger, but if you have room in your luggage, it might be a good option for those traveling in the US.I think it is a decent wall charger with lots of ports, however, unlike other wall chargers I’ve installed in my home, this one does not use a center screw that can be used to secure it to the original receptacle. Depending on how tight the original receptacle is, the process of unplugging any cable could pull the wall charger out of the wall receptacle. Using 2 hands solves the problem, but I prefer the charger be secured so I can unplug cords without pulling the charger out with it.Not a big deal, but that’s why I’m giving 4 stars instead of 5.
Charges iPhone faster than stock charger.Very convenient for bedside charging of phone and insulin pump at night.

reviewTitle: so far so good, not enough experience yet to be able to say more
reviewDescription: so far so good, not enough experience yet to be able to say more
Nice
Alexa or google connection would make this a five star.
Great multipurpose plug & looks good too. I like the shape so plugs are easily accessible. Everything needed for the tv looks organized for once.
I was able to get rid of a power bar with the USB outlets built in to the space of an A/C outlet
The ONLY thing I don’t like about this product is that it’s hard to find a plug for it in some hotels.

The Addtam is an excellent multi plug and USB charger. The design is easy to use and install. The device does not have a screw mount so it is great from traveling. At the same time, for at home use a mounting screw would be best. I have my iPhone, Alexa, and my Apple Watch plugged into the device. I would purchase this again, and recommend.

reviewTitle: Does the job. Comes out of socket too easily
reviewDescription: It does what it says it does. My only problem is that when you try disconnecting anything from it, it comes out of the wall unless you hold it to the wall while pulling.

The video is of me plugging in my phone. As soon as it’s charging, this outlet starts buzzing. It’s taken me a month to realize the sound was coming from this. I’m really sensitive to sounds and have had lots of headaches (literally) from this thing.I want to love it. The design is perfect. But that sound is unbearable to have right next to my bed.
This is a nice unit, multiple use options and would have given it 5 stars except it doesn't stay plugged into the wall. If they could fix that, I'd have one in every room needed. Returning.

reviewTitle: Love the concept; But needs adjustments
reviewDescription: I love the appearance of the product and how it eliminates the need for me to have extension cords or additional surge protectors.  However, this thing falls out of the wall too easily. And everything plugged in, shuts off.  Not good at all….
The USB-C port is useless! I've used three different USB-C cords and it charges no faster than a USB-A.

The USB ports are not powerful enough to charge my smartphone and my hearing aids at the same time.  Neither charged overnight so I woke up not being able to hear and not being able to call anyone until I charged them both separately.

Ordered less than a year ago.  Worked great and as expected at first. Plenty of plugs and USB ports.  USB ports stopped working however. Not sure if it was just my unit or if it speaks to a larger durability issue.
Didn’t like how loose it holds to the outlet. Not a secure right fit

It simply will not stay plugged in.  I use the plug-in for my phone, tablet, and watch.  Just the act of handling the wires moves the charging extender out enough so that there is no power to the inlets.

Takes up two outlets but you gain three.  I liked the idea of having USB ports on it so I could plug in my phone to charge but of the 4 USB ports, not one of them worked.  So I paid $20 for 3 extra outlets.  I could have purchased a power strip for less. I am debating if I should return it.
These work so far.  They don't have a screw that holds them to the outlet.  This is a big problem when you want to unplug a cable.

I got two of these for our bedroom — they both make a high pitched, irritating noise when charging via USB. It’s not super loud, but definitely loud enough to be annoying when you’re trying to sleep.Otherwise seems to be fine, but I’ll be sending these back.

reviewTitle: Buy more than one and check them for operation.
reviewDescription: I bought two and only one the USB works, the second one all 3 of the ports won't work.  I'm going to see if I can get a replacement. They fit nicely on the receptacle and with only one plug in the back you need not worry about a split receptacle that is fed from two different circuits. Bought Feb 2021.

reviewTitle: we like it but a screw was missing
reviewDescription: When like it but a screw is missing  .I wish the company would send the screws.  I feel its unsafe
My mistake for not looking closer.  But this item looks and feels extremely cheap.

reviewTitle: Nice design but pulls right out of the wall easily.
reviewDescription: Wish it had a set screw to connect to house outlet because it wants to just unplug if you don't physically hold it while you pull a plug out.
The 5 AC outlets work, the 3 USB outlets don't work at all. I like it alot, but I will return and rebuy in hopes that I get a new one that does work.
The USB ports stopped working in less than a year
Total usb ports are 4.5A which means if you’re charging 4 devices then they will all charge slowly.  So disappointed that I didn't realize this before buying.

reviewTitle: Very Loud Sound When Using USB Plugs
reviewDescription: This thing emits a loud high pitched noise when you use any of the USA sockets.  Very slow charging rate also. The other plugs seem to work OK.  This looks like it may have been returned before I got it.
With more then 1 item plugged into USB, it states not enough power to charge.

reviewTitle: NOT SURGE PROTECTOR- no rating and no Ground monitoring
reviewDescription: This device appears to be falsely claiming surge protection feature. The device I received does not list any surge protection rating on the nameplate. This would be the only SPD that I've seen that didn't list a transient surge voltage rating. The Amazon listing also states that it monitors for property wired receptalce, but I removed the ground connect by inserting a 3 prong - 2 prong adapter  between the wall receptalce and this device and the green light still was on, even without a ground connection. My other brand SPD devices know when Ground is missing by turning off their 'protected' light. I think this is falsely advertised device by seller. Plan to return device.

Seems like a good product but one thing makes it impractical. There is no way to attach it to a wall outlet. The photo makes it look like there is center screw but it does not exist. Without the benefit of an attachment screw, to remove a plug, you must push against the charger to keep it from pulling out of the wall socket. This may not be a deal breaker but should be considered among the many dozens of options available.
It works, but it comes out of outlet, needs a screw to attach to middle of outlet

reviewTitle: If you're buying it for the fast charge only don't do it
reviewDescription: As soon as you plug it in it says that it's working and then a couple seconds later the fast charges no longer working... So if you're buying it for the fast charge only don't. Everything else is fine!
I was expecting this to connect with some sort of screw but it just plugs into the outlet and the ground plug is simply a piece of plastic. I won’t buy again.
The phone usb ports lasted only 5 monthsOutlet so far working.

Just looked down to see two chargers and a piece of my carpet ablaze… luckily I smelled something beforehand and immediately unplugged it but geeze imagine if I wasn’t home!!! Extremely scary and disappointing

reviewTitle: Too loose of a connection to charge
reviewDescription: The product doesn't have a way to screw it into the outlet and therefore comes loose and doesn't always make a connection to use the USB ports.  Also if you pull a cord out the whole thing comes off the wall. Needed to have a middle screw so that it would adhere to the outlet.

reviewTitle: Great at first.  USB ports stopped working
reviewDescription: This seemed exactly what I needed to charge phones, ipads, etc all in one place.  The USB ports just stopped working after 2 months.  So it's not that useful anymore

reviewTitle: USB ports are convenient but slow
reviewDescription: The USB ports are convenient but they charge slower than single-port plug-in block chargers -- even with only one device plugged in.The 120v outlets are convenient. You can even plug in your old block charger and charge at its full speed!

reviewTitle: Plug it in anywhere with no screws!
reviewDescription: Working fine so far, I mean, it's just a plug. I wanted this one because I don't have to mess with changing out the center screw and can move it anywhere without having to track down a screwdriver (not to mention the original screw from the first outlet).  Good design, but doesn't fit on a switch/switch/outlet combo unfortunately.

I was planning on taking this wall charger on my next trip to Europe however it will not fit into the European plugs.  I have an adapter but with the plastic prong the charger won't fit properly against the wall.

reviewTitle: Functionally working as described, but not flush with wall for a permanent install
reviewDescription: Works as described, but does not fit flush with wall because there is no room on its back side for the normally slightly protruding electrical outlet socket. Irrelevant for traveling but maybe not ideal for a more permanent installation.
Usb changer point week. Very satisfied
Very convenient!
Wound up buying two more of these. They are great.

I use this to replace wall plugins for mobile devices in my office. The USB-C charging port is nice - it works well for smaller devices like phones and mice/keyboard that require USB-C plug to charge.HOWEVER - it is not powerful enough to really charge my MacBook Pro M1. When using the USB-C port to charge, system report shows a charging rate of 15W. This is the bare minimum you could use to charge the laptop. If you want to use the laptop at the same time, chances are it will only hold a charge and will not actually charge the battery.I actually prefer this since I use it to charge the laptop overnight, so time does not matter to me. Plus, this is trickle charging the laptop. Long-term this may help the battery retain its maximum rated energy. Fast charging produces a lot of stress on the battery. Apple does a great job mitigating this via software but I still like to slow-charge devices if possible.

reviewTitle: May not fit all outlets and hang in the right direction for plugging in devices
reviewDescription: I like the multiple outlets and USB ports, but I could not get it plug into a GFCI outlet.  One end would plug in but the single post for the secondary outlet seemed misaligned just slightly so I couldn't use it in that outlet (which was the intended outlet).  It did fit in a normal outlet but doesn't seem to fit snugly/securely - meaning, if you pull out a plug, the whole charger pulls out too.  Lastly, depending on the outlets in your home, this charge may end up being plugged in upside down from the way you might plan.
A bit bulky on the wall. But it works great
I can charge all my gadgets

reviewTitle: Could have burnt my house down!
reviewDescription: Within 15 seconds of plugging this into the wall and plugging a charger/device in, it burnt my daughter's finger and melted the charger. Had we walked away for even a minute, it would have caught on fire, no doubt. Do NOT purchase this item.

reviewTitle: It could have started a fire
reviewDescription: Plugged this into the wall for one time only.  Used it to charge my iPhone with the iPhone cord.  Looked at my phone cord after 20 minutes of charging and the end of the cord that was attached to my phone was charred and melted.  This could have started a fire.

My first purchase, the right side plugs don’t work. You can’t even plug anything into the holes. The replacement product Amazon sent has the same problem.Disappointed cuz we have these already around the house from a purchase a long time ago and we loved them. Manufacturing quality has gone down!

reviewTitle: Sparked and flamed after pulling out low use device
reviewDescription: Luckily I was the one pulling out my son’s LED light strip, which like the few other things attached was off at the time. As I pulled it out, there was a massive spark and quick flame. Very dangerous

reviewTitle: Does Not Work With Standard Outlet
reviewDescription: I have received two of these and neither of them fit in a standard outlet. reviewDescription: It's okay for one or two plugs/USB ports to be used at a time, but at three - it shuts off randomly, even if it was not connected to anything at the other end. As in, the wires are not charging anything, but the device still shuts down. It also makes a noise. Don't buy it. I wish I could return it or get a replacement.

When I first opened it up it looked okay. When I went to plug it in it was a little wobbly and lose and now the things I plug into hang halfway out of the plug or fall out compleatly even when the cords are not being moved or pulled on. This is not safe would not buy again.
Both items only had one socket that was aligned correctly that you could even plug something into it. Returning this sketchy thing immediately.
Bought it on 9/13. Stopped working on 11/24.
Worked great for a few months - then the USB outlets stopped working.  Return window is closed now.  Buy with caution.
The USB ports are defunct in this product

reviewTitle: Good idea, now if it only worked.
reviewDescription: Received product, let it warm up as it was cold when delivered, plugged it in and tried the usb and usb-c ports to charge my laptops and phone. Only 2 of the 3 usb ports worked and the usb-c port does not work either. Use the chargers that came with your equipment and forget this one!!!

The device give the illusion of supporting several devices.  My family plugged in an electric toothbrush, iPhone, iWatch and iPad mini.  The 3rd USB port wouldn’t charge.  When we unplugged one of the USB ports, the 3rd port worked.  The plug in the back goes into 1 of the 2 outlets, not both.  Not sure that it would make a difference if there were connections in both outlets.  Disappointed.  Just go with a reliable extension cord.

I returned it immediately because unlike another unit I ordered, it doesn’t have the wall plate mounting screw option.That is most important if you want a safe and secure extension outlet instead of having it loose and possibly a hazard.

reviewTitle: DO NOT PURCHASE - Almost caught on fire!!
reviewDescription: ONE iPhone charging cord plugged into wall outlet (not even connected to a device). Charger literally melted into wall outlet. Had I not been sitting next to the wall where it was plugged in and smelled the melting plastic I don’t even want to imagine what would have happened. DO NOT BUY!!

reviewTitle: Thought it was good until it burned my outlet
reviewDescription: Beware!!! It was going good until one night. Saw a big spark out of nowhere. Thought it was it just tripping because we might have overloaded it with a coffee pot, pressure cooker, and rice cooker. Well a week later only went to plug a bottle warmer into it and it popped the breaker in the house. So i flipped the breaker and went to plug this unit alone in nothing else and popped the breaker again. This time huge sparks and damaged the outlet. It was a new outlet about 2 years old. Would not buy again or recommend.

Sturdiness?I was initially delighted by this but looked at it today and was horrified by the burned and blackened mess.  This is supposed to have overcurrent safety and a fireproof shell not to mention several other safety features.See the pics, it almost burned my house downDo not buy this
None of the USB ports work, only the plugs
If you have multiple things plugged into it, it gets too heavy and falls out. Also the USB - C doesn’t always work.
I had my phone and watch charging. Thank goodness I was nearby. I heard a pop and there was smoke coming from the charger. Thankfully, my phone and watch were not damaged.

reviewTitle: The listing lies about USB capability.
reviewDescription: This device does not deliver the stated USB power levels. It doesn't even come close to the requirements for quick charge capabilities. See attached image of the battery metrics from my phone when plugged into the USB ports on the device.

This leaves me concerned at the level of quality control, craftsmanship and potential fire risk. If the prongs are bent, there could be something loose inside that could become a big problem.I plan to return it.
Tried to use it on a GFCI outlet in the bathroom and it won't fit. There is a stabilizing rod that goes into the lower outlet and that rod doesn't line up.

reviewTitle: USB chargers stopped working within less than two months
reviewDescription: DO NOT recommend because the USB stopped charging within two months. Obviously, I cannot return it, so it’s a complete waste of money.

It was a brand new transmitter ($150 + $35 to send it overnight) 1 month old.  The surge protector was plugged into it for 1 week and the transmitter is fried and is now beeping.  Talking to the dog fence people, the transmitter has a blown fuse and has to be replaced.  It was like the transmitter had no surge protector at all.  I would like my money back and you should pay for a new transmitter since your product completely failed 1 week after being used

So overall this is a nice design. I bought it for my room because it seemed like it would take up less space. Well it did not protect my things plugged into it. Everything plugged in doesn't work now. The surge protected light was on as well. Will not recommend this to anyone and will not buy in the future. The one I had is now in the trash. Super disappointed.

reviewTitle: Warning-PULLS OUT OT THE WALL-No center screw
reviewDescription: Wife hates me-she keeps pulling it out of the wall. There are better choices.

reviewTitle: Purchased three and none of them actually worked!
reviewDescription: I’ll call shenanigans on the solid five star rating on this item. I bought three of them and plugged in a few things per unit, and the only things that would actually turn on where my Amazon Alexa, and my cell phone charger. The lamps wouldn’t even turn on! It doesn’t supply enough power to turn on lamps, purifiers, and I’m not even sure how long it took overnight for my cell phone to charge because I did see other reports of slow cell phone charging as well. I returned all three of them the next day, and ordered two other units that I should’ve purchased in the first place because I already own one and they are amazing!
The electrical plugs worked/work. But the USB ports, although working initially, no longer work. I would not buy this product again.

Nice outlet placement and sits in outlet securely. However some problems. It radiates RFI noise and my tabletop radio is now noisy if the charger is plugged into the wall. My iPad won’t charge completely. Moreover if my iPad is charging, and I plug headphones into my iPad, I hear noise. I regret buying 2 of these.
Since Receiving this device, I'm only been able to charge With one port at a time.  Ports do not charge with multiple devices.  Have it 2 stats because it does charge fast with only 1port at a time.
After less than 3 months of use, the USB and USB-C ports stopped charging. It is now a glorified power strip.

reviewDescription: Don't believe the lies, this does not support quick charging, expect about 4 hours to charge a phone and forget about charging your ipad on this. Its crazy how many good reviews this thing has and not a single one mention the fact it doesn't charge phones or ipad effectively.

reviewTitle: A cwey convenients multi oulet port
reviewDescription: All is good, but I was expecting that the USB outlets would be capabale of delivering fast charge and it is just as a normal conector does , but not a fast one for C type.

reviewDescription: Worked for 3 months and stopped working

reviewTitle: falls out of wall socket, lacks screw to hold it inplace
reviewDescription: if you ar OK with having to hold this device in place with one hand while pluging in or out either a USB cable or plug then this device works. But for me this is a real pain so I donated it to Goodwill in the hope that someone will find a use for it

it sticks out because the bottom does not go into the plug all the way

reviewTitle: Unsure About this Wall Charger/Surge Protector
reviewDescription: This brand is an unknown name to me and I have my doubts about it.No documentation was included with the device - no user manual, no warranty card. Are the specs as listed on Amazon accurate? Does this thing have a real warranty? I was not able to find a website for Addtam.
Mediocre. Heavy plug in. Unbplugs easily
No use issues yet but the physical build is a bit sloppy. My USB cords have to be angled down in order to get them to slide in properly. Can't recommend this outlet.

Like most people said, this is underpowered. I left my phone plugged in, both with a fast charger and direct usb on the device, and my phone did not charge overnight. It held the power at whatever I went to sleep with.

It is convenient to get multiple plugs into the outlet without a dropcord....but the USB port isn't even powerful enough to run ONE wireless charger.  I have to use the regular plug in part that the charger came with still.....kind of defeated the purpose of buying this product.  So all the USB ports are sitting unused.....LOL
Worked but doesn't fit over outlet well.
Was what I was expecting

reviewTitle: Not the best quality control, does work though.
reviewDescription: The electrical pins are mobile in the back, the construction seems subpar. The front is nice and the ports work.The item does fit over the electrical socket which is fine, but worth noting. The stability when plugged in may have been stronger if that was part of the design to go over the back plate.
This work great, have several different types of pug styles to choose from.I also like that, I don’t have all the cords from the strip style protectors to deal with, less clutter is always better.

reviewTitle: So far, it's been worth the purchase
reviewDescription: I like that I don't need to constantly unplug cords/ find USB plug ins.  One thing I wish were improved would be replacing one of the USB ports with the USBC since it seems technology is going that direction.

reviewTitle: Nicely made, NOT for GFCI or decora style outlets tho
reviewDescription: The quality of this is great and it looks nice. It will NOT plug into GFI or GFCI outlets tho. Make sure you’re aware of what outlet you intend to put this on before buying and finding out it won’t plug into your outlet. The spacing of the ground holes in GFI type outlets makes it impossible to plug this into one. It odd only slightly off but it is important to know. Also to mount it to the wall properly you need access to the faceplate screw hole in the outlet. This means it won’t work well on decora style plugs if at all because you can’t mount it properly.
Good item for school dormitories.

This power plug mostly works. All of the outlets work except for the USB drives. None of them work. I thought about returning it except for the fact that I use the power plug my devices came with to plug into this device, so they aren't needed. It would have been nice to have them, though. Otherwise I like this device quite well.

reviewTitle: Good for USB, USB-C, and outlet AC
reviewDescription: I liked the idea of slanted outlets for looks & functional cord dressing.I liked the different USB ports.  That has come in handy!  aka: USB-C, USB, & other USB.The unit is Too big as it hangs over the cover plate and things like cabinets and the like that crowd the duplex make it unusable in the kitchen where cell phoneS & tabletS live. aka: USB portS!  Back to Lowes for outlets with USBs ports.  I WISH!

reviewTitle: Great concept - be sure you know where you are putting it.
reviewDescription: The unit works great.  But be sure you know where you are going to use it.  We have it in a narrow area which limits what I can plug into it because of the angles.  Otherwise great piece.

Easy to use. Just plug in. Fits perfect in front of my bed. No more mess of tangled cords everywhere. Seems durable, but I haven’t had it long enough. I think it's a little large to use while traveling.

This is a good product, just be advised that the wattage output by the USB-C may be not be enough for a laptop. It charges mine (Thinkpad X1), but the laptop complains when on a high load and suspends, since it doesn't get enough juice to power it fully.
Lil bulky

reviewTitle: Works great but has a flaw
reviewDescription: This product works really well and does everything it states it does. The biggest issue compared to others is that it does not have a screw to hold it in place. So occasionally it does become unplugged. Something to consider when purchasing. If you don;t unplug things often it is a great choice.

This has been so handy and really helped clean up the mess of cords and plugs on my counter. It made so much of a difference, I bought another one and will probably add one to each room of the house. Happy with this!

It is a great compact unit to be able to plug so much into it. My only tiny grope, it doesn't feet weighty enough, when you want a surge protector, I come from the "if it weighs a ton it must be doing something to stop surges" this is a very versatile small unit, but it is very lightweight
I have this plug into my kitchen island and it’s a great addition to my kitchen island. Can charge any device and have enough outlets for my cooking utensils.
I like this outlet extender. It works well, except that I do wish there was more variety in the size of the ports. It’s hard to find that feature in anything. Otherwise it’s great!
It’s hard to say anything about this product because in my bathroom space where I need it, it was just too wide. I replaced it with different one and I am happy now.
I liked the outlet extender. However, usbc outlet stopped working after 1year.
USB ports stopped working: defeats a purpose for purchasing. :(

I guess I can blame myself for this, I should have studied it a bit closer, but maybe someone can benefit from my lesson learned. The thing is, if you plug anything in, you Might want to unplug it... and when you do the whole thing comes out of the wall socket. Unless you have the strength to remove one plug with two hands. I don't! I need a third hand or someone else to do it, who Might not be around. There's NO way to fasten it to the wall socket. Sometimes More is Not better!
It doesn’t feel secure on the outlet. Perhaps using both sides of the outlet would improve that. Maybe have it so you have to remove the old faceplate and secure it with a screw.
I love it but the outlets I have are tamper/child proof so the plastic pin that goes into the ground slot doesn’t want to go into the bottom outlet.

Very nice surge protector but the big problem, it simple comes in a nice nondescript box with no documentation with the item. Searched online but could not find anything about the product other than what was in the description this website.Website states 1800 joules surge protection, for those in the know, 1800 joules is considered very good but keep in mind this item is not UL listed rather it is ETL listed and according to information on back of item. It is UL STD 498a listed but this simply means the outlets are deemed safe. FYI - UL 1449 is the Underwriters Laboratories Safety Standard for Surge Protective Devices (SPD) is not found on item or any documentation.Had to return this item...
It didn't stay in the wall for me it might be my wall plugs I tried it in a few different ones.

I have bought other brand outlet extenders in the past and I guess I assumed this one would be similar but it is not. All the others had a mounting screw so it can be fixed firmly to the wall. This one does not. So whenever I pull a plug out it often will pull the whole extender out as well, actually all the time if I am not careful. So that's kind of a problem for me. So I have replaced it with one of the other brands and have relegated this to a backup role. i.e. into the junk drawer it goes. Just giving anyone a heads-up.

The most important aspect of this is the undisclosed warranty.  I constantly look for it whenever I buy something - regardless of the cost of the unit.  (See my posted question as a reference.)  I contacted the company and they noted twelve months.  This, to me, is worth considering more, especially when the price is right.  Otherwise, I'd get the alternate/competitor without a second thought.As an adaptor, it's a really good design.  I needed this to be simple and space efficient with different plugs.  This is used in my kitchen where I plan to use at least one of the USB ports for holiday night light(s), and at least one of the regular plugs for a coffee maker that has it's own plug switch.  So it'll need lots of spacing, but won't be overloaded.  The spacing of the outlets is the key because of the positioning of the USB part sufficiently out of the way. I prefer this style over the competitors as it's a very clean and simple look with no seams or creases on the edges, and matches well with a plain white wall. The problem is, it doesn't attach firmly or securely to the outlet without screw-in support.  I've found others that do, I just don't like their outer, faceplate style as much.As a surge protector, I won't know until it's needed.  But it's nice to know that it's ready.
I like having all the slots. However, the charging power is quite slow and I have both types of cables. Other than that its good.
Great for phones and iPads. The description said it works for MacBook Air via C, however it doesn’t work. Thought you should know

Just starting using it yesterday, so these are initial impressions. Giving it a three for now, but may downgrade depending on how much more annoyed I get with it. Don't feel like going through the return process, but still might. You can't plug anything into one of the five regular outlets, something about the shape prevents the plug from sinking. It also is kind of unstable, every time it gets bumped it tilts in the socket despite having a plastic brace the fits into the lower socket. Since I am using this in my kids' room as their charging station, it gets bumped often when they take their tablets off the chargers plugged into the USB sockets. It seems fairly sturdy, though.
There's no way to secure this to the outlet so if you pull a plug out, the whole unit will come out as well. Definitely get an option that has a way to screw the outlet to the wall outlet.

On paper, this surge protector has everything I need plus USB charging. I wanted something that would be hidden behind a piece of furniture without having set it on the floor or mount it off the floor. Unfortunately, most of the direct plug-in surge protectors don't offer as much protection as corded protectors. Unfortunately, this comes with no documentation. From the description online, it offers 1800 Joules of protection and the light indicates active surge protection. There is no mention of a warranty anywhere. One reviewer mentioned it does not fit GFCI outlets. There is warning on the back that states not to use it with GFCI outlets. There is a plastic piece that fits into the lower outlet to help secure it in place, but there is no center bolt. That's unimportant if you have a decora outlet which have not use a center hole for mounting the outlet plate. I won't be using the USB ports, so I can't comment on how they work.This surge protector does meet my needs, but I would be hesitant to trust its protection for anything significant value. (All of the devices I have connected are either very old or inexpensive.)
Overall, I guess it's a good product, but I'm disappointed that one of the USB ports has already stopped charging.

This had plenty of wattage to allow for a microwave and a freezer (not much more). This has a USB-C and USB ports and the angled 110v were nice as well.However it is easy to fall out of the wall. A nicer unit allows you screw through the middle into the plug plate, stopping it from falling out of the wall. This unit does NOT have that. You will need to tape, glue or lean something on it to keep it from falling out of the wall socket.If I would have payed attention to the fact it doesn't screw into the plug, I would NOT have purchased this product.

At the time of the review, I've had this unit for 3 month. This is a great power outlet that expands AC ports as well as adding extra USB charging ports. It added a ton of functionality and convenience.However, I only give it a 3-star for its One potential caveat, so people in my similar situation can be aware of what may be in store. I had mine plugged in next to my night stand, and 3 months in, I started to notice a high pitch noise coming out of the outlet. It gets louder as more load is connected to the USB portable. I'm blessed with relatively good hearing (I was hope that happened to my vision as well, oh well), and in the middle of night, when all the devices are plugged and ambient is ultra quiet, the noise started to affect my sleep as it get very annoying during quasi-sleep state. I started to disconnect the unit at night and looking for a potential replacement.Overall, I recommend this to anyone who will place the unit far away from where he/she sleeps.
It could be faster.

reviewTitle: Works, would prefer if I could screw it in
reviewDescription: We have had no issues with it working. However, I've had to push it back into the wall a couple times because other family members have left it not fully plugged in after unplugging something. It would be helpful if it had a screw in the middle like some other products do. I'm even considering replacing it with one that does and moving this to some place that has has things plugged in more permanently.

reviewTitle: Does the job but needs one more feature
reviewDescription: I like this outlet for its versatility, but it could use a long screw to attach to the outlet.  In order to pull a plug from this unit, you need to hold it so that it doesn't pull out of the socket.

reviewTitle: Does NOT plug into GFI outlets
reviewDescription: I bought these to use in the kitchen where I have 2 GFI outlets with 3 small appliances and a microwave plus 2 under counter lighting strips that can plug into USB ports ... only to find out they don't fit in a GFI outlet so they were totally useless for my needs.They are also not especially well made - I couldn't plug in a Glade plugins air freshener in either of them, and the USB C outlet doesn't feel like it connects very well. I now have them in a bedroom and a living room outlet where they fit but aren't anywhere near as useful for me.
The item does not have a screw to secure ot to the wall, resulting in having to hold it to remove or change items plugged into it.

reviewTitle: I didn’t need a night light
reviewDescription: Functions as advertised. Has a green light that’s always on and can’t be turned off. I wish it was clear that this is essentially also a night light that can’t be turned off. If you’re okay with a bright green light and this isn’t for a bedroom it should work for you.

I bought this product in order to not have power strips sitting on the floor under my bedside table. It did a great job at that, it really tidied up all the cords I have. The problem is that eight months later, it simply quit working. I did reach out to the company via Amazon to see if there was a warranty option, and never heard back. All in all, I liked it for the eight months it did work, but I would not buy it again because it does not seem to be built to last.
Unfortunately this product does not do maximum speed fast charging for iPhones via the USB-C outlet.

I like the design except that both prongs are the same width, and it doesn't screw into your outlet, so it could easily be knocked loose. Unfortunately if you're trying to use your phone while it's charging, you'll wind up with a dead phone. I tried out a bunch of configurations with cords, adapters, and the wall outlet, testing charge times, and this thing is getting recycled. Disappointing.
This was a pretty decent outlet extender for a while, until the USBC charging port just stopped working. It still lights up, but it gives no charge after trying multiple cables and devices.
A uno de los dos que compré no le funcionan los puertos usb
Great for a yearIt stopped working after thatDisappointing
Product works to connect power but the bottom prong is not low enough for any outlet in my home. Looks really tacky.
Works good

reviewTitle: Takes care of a landline, modem, & chargers multiple devices. What’s not to like?
reviewDescription: Reasonably priced. Good quality. As advertised

reviewTitle: Works properly as far as I have tested, No way to remove green LED protection light
reviewDescription: I have this unit in my bedroom, and it works properly. I like my room to be dark at night, and since there is no way for the green LED protection light to be switched off or properly covered, I make the effort to unplug this unit in its entirety at nighttime. But, if this unit is not in a bedroom, then there really is not an issue!

I use this throughout the house and take it with me when I travel. It is a must have if you have multiple electronics that you need access to at the same time. And it’s perfect in a household with multiple users who need access to outlets and charging options.

reviewTitle: Works well, but can start to fall off outlet if too heavy from plugs
reviewDescription: All the ports work well, but if you plug too many things in and it gets too heavy, it’ll start to fall out of the outlet. For example, when you go and unplug one of the plugs, the whole thing will fall off the outlet. You just have to be careful and hold it in place, don’t yank on it. But other than that it’s totally fine.
Very good. Does the job.
A must if you need to plug multiple cords at once. I haven't had any issues.
It works great but when you use usb-c it doesn’t give enough power to run my Apple HomePod had to add the block and use the regular outlet
I got two of these, thinking that it would solve the problem of my outlets being wired with one outlet being switched. It didn't work for that, but makes a good outlet extender with usb.

Works awesome, love it, sturdy and high quality. Only issue (I think it's my outlets honestly) is it does tend to come loose/fall off the wall if you're active near it or bumping it. Would buy again though!

reviewTitle: Can't have to many USB power sockets, that's what I say!
reviewDescription: I use these mainly around the house.  I think I bought 8 and all have been put to good use.
This product works well as it has multi uses as  phone chargers and other outlets for appliances, etc.
Great to have
Nice looking and with plenty of outlets to use - including USB and type C ports.
I used this to protect my tv,  my cellphone and the printer from power surges. It is easy to install and to utilize it.
I would 1 for every room that has alot of stuff to plus in I have one in every bed room
Looks nice and works well. I love the safety features and its durability - good quality.
We use this in our bathroom to charge razors, toothbrush’s etc.  works great for everything.

My house is woefully low on plugins for a tech generation. Even more frustrating, is that less and less of the plugs have grounded outlets. This means the grounded outlets are even more important. As a result, we have a lot of power strips. Unfortunately, power strips take up a lot of space and aren't the most well designed for charging items. Lately I've been getting additional electronics for my aquarium and plants, and they seem to come with either USBs as the plugin or a charger adapter for USB. Since none of my old outlets are designed for USB it's even more frustrating. Fortunately, this outlet adapter allows you to have USB directly plug in plus it is designed so that charging units are actually spaced far enough apart that they make sense. Words can't express how happy I've been now that I don't have to hunt around for adapters and plugs!

reviewTitle: The usb charges slow but it's a good piece
reviewDescription: I like the way it looks, and that I can plug multiple things in at once and that it has different ports for phone charging. It charges the phones pretty slow though

reviewTitle: Worked for 4 months and then died
reviewDescription: Originally bought to charge my apple products. Loved the multiple outlets that could charge various things. Unfortunately, 4 months later, 1 month after the warranty was up, it has just stopped charging altogether. Tried it on multiple outlets and nothing works anymore. Tried reaching out to customer support and was just told that the time had passed to get a refund or replacement. I understand company’s have policies but I’m disappointed in the product and wouldn’t recommend.

The USB plugs would not charge my iPad. The regular plugs work, and it does look better than what I had there before, so it stays. However if you’re looking at this for reliance upon the USB charging, I would look elsewhere.

reviewTitle: Does not secure to the outlet, is easily accidentally loosened.
reviewDescription: This outlet does not screw into the wall like most outlet extenders. I had my bread maker plugged into the side, and my teenager had their devices plugged into the front. My kid accidentally loosened the entire plug block. He didn’t notice, and my bread machine turned off. Ruining it obviously. And so while I really like the number of outlets and the look and design of the plug, I have to be careful not to use it for anything that will be interrupted if it’s unplugged.

After looking through more reviews and how hot it got in a short amount of time. I do not want to use this in my house. We tested a night light in it and it got really bright then the bulb burnt out within a minute.
We ordered 2. One works great, the other has multiple outlets that do not work and it is outside of the return window now. Very disappointed with the quality.

reviewTitle: The make a annoying buzzing sound
reviewDescription: Almost perfect but the sound drives me crazy
Only one lamp and a recliner chair with heat were plugged into 120v. One cell phone wire plugged in. The 120v failed after one year and I don't know why.

reviewTitle: C pot and USB stopped working
reviewDescription: The wall charger is decent but the usb and c ports stopped working.
The left side could not plug in - no review at this point

reviewTitle: This item doesn't screw into the receptacle.
reviewDescription: Since it doesn't screw into the receptacle, it isn't very secure. In order to unplug anything, you MUST hold onto the outlet extender. Also, if you plug more than a couple of things into it, it pulls away from the wall. Look for outlet extenders that actually attach to the receptacle.
I do NOT recommend thisToo Expensive, poor build quality
TYPE C PORT AND SOME USB PORTS DOESN'T WORK

reviewTitle: Should have looked closer for screw mount
reviewDescription: Perfect except for the lack of a screw mount..falls out and can damage electronics doing that...get one with screw mount for plug in wall.

It’s sturdy and heavy. It has an extra plastic piece so it actually takes up 2 plug spaces (one for the actual plug and the 2nd for the plastic piece which I think works as a secure Mount). The reason I didn’t like it is bc the usb charge Is slow and when you want to remove it from the wall plug you have to hold down the actual wall plug I order not to pull out the whole wall socket.
I bought 2 of these. One of them the USB port won't work for my cell phone, it works on every thing else though. The other one works great!

reviewTitle: No Centers Screw to hold on wall.
reviewDescription: There is no centers screw to a fix on wall. After plugging in something, it pulls the unit out from the wall.

reviewTitle: Good Wall Hub, USB C Port Died
reviewDescription: I would like to say that I’d give this hub 5 stars if the Type C port didn’t die out on me! I really like the design of this one, it’s nice to have a few more wall sockets and a USB hub all in one. Everything was working as expected until a couple days ago, after about 7 months of having a wireless charger connected to it the USB type C port went kaput. Overall a very good product, everything else is working wonderfully.
I like the device but I thought it would have a screw in the middle to anchor it down in place of the receptacle face plate. Not thrilled with the electrical concerns of arcing.
This covers both outlets, however, only plugs into one. There is a plastic peg that is supposed to go into the ground part of the 2nd outlet. However it doesn't go in all the way and it's not tight.

reviewTitle: More you plug in the lower the charge
reviewDescription: Good in theory but the more you plug in, more than 2, other things won’t charge. Nice having the USB ports.
Only has 1 amp per usb outlet!  This means its a very slow charger!

After only 6 months of using it (Had only a printer and few USB charger connected) It almost caused fire.One morning I woke up from the burning smell and I thought it was the outlet itself. After a while testing this and that, I realized it was this wall charger. All others were fine, but it started heating up again when this was plugged in.Potentially fire hazard product and this should be banned from Amazon.

reviewTitle: It keeps shorting out, not working
reviewDescription: It only works if I'm holding it or if I keep wiggling it. They seems to have a shortage or something - doesn't seem super safe to keep using.
Usb charging stopped working after 60 days …. after the 30 day return window

reviewTitle: It melted and almost burned up!! Hard no!!
reviewDescription: I bought this in November of 2022 and as of March 29, 2023 upon returning from spring break this is what the outlet looked like. we unplugged it immediately. Sure do wish I could get my money back!! Buyer beware.

reviewTitle: Loud ringing noise when connected to USB-C port.
reviewDescription: I bought this mainly for the USB-C port. Unfortunately whenever I’m connected using an Apple USB-C to lightning cable, the adapter makes a high pitched ringing noise. I tried using an ANKER USB-C to lightning cable as well, and it makes a really loud and unpleasant ring. If you’re connected near your bed, you’re gonna hear this noise. I might sensitive to the ring... As it turns out, I won’t be using the USB-C port which seems like a waste. I could’ve gotten a cheaper option instead.
Needs to go on a single outlet as it will cover the other outlet side on double outlets

It is very difficult to insert USB male plug into USB receptacle on this unit due to misalignment of the internal connectors with the housing. If the housing does not align with internal connections which then leads me to believe that it was poorly manufactured as there is clearly no attention to detail.
Will not charge 2 usb-c devices simultaneously. Can’t recommend to anyone looking to charge multiple devices at the same time
I paid for the 2 pack and only received 1.  Now I have to waste my time returning it.
